column4: can anyone tell me how to disable the gnome login screen in command line?
always, I checked "enable accessibility options" once and from then on it hangs consistently
you just want a terminal? You need to remove the symlinks to gdm from your /etc/rc5.d/ dir
also from the /etc/rc4.d/ and any other /etc/rcX.d/ dir's
can you walk me through it, my IRC client crashed so I forgot what you said
No, but I can tell you again... there are directories /etc/rc0.d/ through /etc/rc6.d/ ... if you remove the symlinks to gdm from those directories, the login manager (gdm) will not be started
Ok, so I don't have to edit any files, I just have to remove them? (sorry, I'm a newbie)
then maybe you shouldn't be messing with this kinda stuff :)
well, I think messing things up is a good way to learn :)
runlevels are different stages the system goes through during startup... 0 through 5 (6 = shutting down). Whent he system moves to the next stage, it runs the programs in those directories
so, in /etc/rc4.d/ and rc5.d are links to programs to run. You want to remove (for example) 'S13gdm' from /etc/rc5.d/
ok, so I am in /etc/rc0.d adn I see "k01gdm" in there, should I remove that?
I believe so, but you should keep track of what you do incase you need to restore it
mind you, my advise comes with no warranty ;)
I did what you said and when I boot it goes into command line, but what I need is to be able to start GDM without the login screen
sorry if I wasn't clear before
